Title: Azure Cloud Engineer / Project Manager
Job_Description:
JOB
DEFINITIONUnder the general direction of the Information Technology Director, performs administrative and technical work in order to achieve optimum use of the court’s computer networks by performing needs analysis, procurement support, installation, monitoring, training and problem resolution for the local area, wide area network and related applications. This position is responsible for configuration, installation, administration and designing of server hardware, operating systems, applications and communications links. DISTINGUISHING CHARACTERISTICSAllocation to a class level is based on factors including but not limited to the complexity of the analytical work, scope of the impact, level of independent judgment and the accountability for the work of other project participants. This technical journey-level class reports directly to, and receives general supervision from, the Information Technology Director, is expected to have hardware, operating system and networking knowledge, and are primarily responsible for the Court’s network which includes administering server hardware, operating systems and related network applications, communication systems, local area network design, wide area network, server design and implementation. Employees at this level are expected to possess the required knowledge and Information Security certification. Incumbents must work independently and determine general work methods and procedures to achieve the assigned goals and objectives. Tasks assigned to require an in-depth and broader understanding of problem identification, analysis and resolution. This class is distinguished from Information Technology Analyst in that the latter performs less complex duties involving the local area network and wide area network. The Network Engineer is responsible for the overall security of the Court’s information systems, and the IT Analyst is responsible only for the security of systems and applications assigned and requires no advanced networking configuration duties. EMPLOYMENT AT WILLThe Network Engineer classification is established as an "at will" position and, as such, the incumbent serves at the pleasure of the Court Executive Officer. The Court Executive Officer has the right to terminate the employment of any incumbent in this classification at any time, with or without advance notice, and with or without cause. JUDGMENT AND RESPONSIBILITYIncumbents work under direction to perform most duties independently based on general policies, procedures and standards. However, incumbents must sometimes make decisions that may have multiple alternative solutions and may involve the occasional development of new techniques and procedures. Priorities are established by the overall needs of the Court and the applications running on the network, these needs can change frequently. Errors in the design or function of automated systems can potentially cause sever disruption to judicial processes and results. Incumbents may supervise other Technology staff.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
When assigned, all of the essential functions and tasks listed below must be accomplished effectively, are standard, and may not be inclusive of all functions and tasks that may be assigned. The court reserves the right to assign or reassign duties as required to achieve business and operational objectives. Essential functions and tasks may include, but are not limited to those listed below. Works independently on large-scale and/or complex network projects, as well as other large and/or complex Court projects, as assigned;Performs system and network configurations, upgrades, deployment, problem resolution, performance monitoring and administration of network server hardware, storage, and operating systems, applications and communications links;Performs network and systems analysis, training and provides procurement support and problem resolution for all IT infrastructure and network services;Conducts feasibility studies and prepares reports of time estimates, personnel requirements, and progress reports on assigned project;Monitors changes and developments of the computer network and systems field by attending seminars, conferences and lectures, and by reviewing professional literature; evaluates their application to Court activities and recommends implementation;Maintains the backup and disaster recovery systems;Administers daily LAN/WAN operations and performance, adjusts and upgrades LAN/WAN hardware, software, applications and storage to maintain performance requirements;Develops and documents internal IT policies and procedures related to change control, network access, usage and security;Performs any project and priority work as assigned by management;Performs active directory, DHCP and DNS management and configuration;Performs Security Audits and MaintenancePrepares Security and Disaster Recovery play book and response kitsCompares the Courts policies and procedures against NIST and IEEE standards.Strong team player and possess excellent customer service and problem solving skills.Occasionally works evenings, nights and weekends and may be on-call on a rotating basis.Travels to courthouses in and outside Placer County required on a regular basis;May act as team lead in the absence of the Information Technology Director

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Possession of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business Information Systems, or a closely related field is required. AND Experience: Five (5) years’ of progressively responsible and related experience supporting LANS’s (System & Network) and WAN’s in mid-large environment. Certifications: The following certifications must be obtained within one (1) year of employment and kept current through the course of employment with Placer Superior Court.CompTIA A+CompTIA N+MCSACCNACisco Cyber Security (may substitute with current CISSP or CISM certification) The Placer County Superior Court will pay for incumbent to attend class for initial certification and subsequent renewals. The court will reimburse incumbent for two test per certification and renewal. Failure to obtain or maintain certifications may result in separation of employment. Knowledge Of: Network Topologies, protocols, Security, Network System management, and interconnectivity requirements for internal/external information transmission;Current data communications techniques and technologies, such as PC’s, bridges, routers, fiber distributed data interface, T1; Principles, practices, and techniques of technical problem resolution of computer systems; methods of ensuring efficient systems operation and maintenance;Windows 2008/2012,2016 and 2019 Server and network administration and optimization;Active Directory and security management, including Group Policy Objects;MS Exchange, SQL Server 2010/ 2014,2016 and 2019 IIS, IAS, DHCP, DNS administration;CISCO routers and switches configuration;Cloud computing principles and practices;TCP/IP and WAN ConceptsCitrixVM WareSPLUNK IT Security and Disaster Recovery Concepts and policies. Ability To: Perform project management including scheduling, developing critical paths, tracking, contingency planning, resource allocation, and team leadership;Develop long-range systems and network strategies;Communicate effectively with all levels of management;Be flexible and adaptable to continually changing demands or situations;Prepare clear, concise and accurate program documentation, and user procedures;Build effective work teams; andEstablish and maintain effective working relationships.

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
This document is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by individuals assigned to this job classification. It is not intended to provide an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities of personnel in all divisions and/or a location so classified, nor are it intended to limit the authority of supervisors or manager to assign or direct the activities of employee. Other Requirements: License Requirement: Possession of a valid driver’s license may be required depending on the position or the ability to provide alternate methods of transportation that meets job requirements. Proof of adequate vehicle insurance and medical clearance may also be required.Physical Requirements: Personal mobility to work in various office settings, locations and in confined work spaces; manual dexterity to use computers and standard office equipment; ability to lift and carry items weighing up to fifty (50) pounds; physical ability to sit for extended periods of time; stoop, reach overhead, bend, crawl, climb stairs and climb ladders to access equipment; finger and manual dexterity to operate a computer keyboard and work with small wiring and cables; vision which can be corrected to a level sufficient to read hand-written, typed and computer generated information and data, as well as computer terminal displays; hearing and speech ability sufficient to enable communication by telephone and in person. Occasional exposure to electrical current.Reasonable accommodation may be available to a qualified individual with disability that will enable them to perform the essential functions of this classification. If reasonable accommodation is required to participate in the recruitment process or to perform any of the functions and related tasks assigned or which may be assigned, please contact the Human Resources Division.Working Conditions: Job duties are generally performed in an indoor office setting with environmental controls. Assigned incumbents are expected to work inside buildings, alone, or closely with others. Assigned work is performed in a standard court setting with open cubicles and/or offices. Routine noises and noise levels occur within the work environment. Staff may be assigned to various court locations in the county. Travel to courthouses in and outside Placer County required on a regular basis. This position may require long hours and some weekend work. Alternate work shifts and overtime may occur, and on-call work may be assigned. Criminal History and Background Checks: Candidates are required to pass a fingerprint clearance by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) and Department of Justice (DOJ). Convictions, depending on the type, number and date, may be disqualifying.

All other duties as assigned.

We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career.

When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.

AECOM is actively seeking a highly motivated Systems Management Administrator II in South Florida.

Provides daily operations support and maintenance for network systems (including wireless). Proactively monitors networks to provide stable, dependable network services across multiple platforms. Configures and troubleshoots computer networks. Maintains LAN/WAN/wireless operations by working with network facility and hardware/software vendors to ensure timely problem resolution. Maintains and utilizes network management applications to identify network faults, to ensure the provision of data or other telecommunications access to customers, and the movement of information from one location to the other. Travel required. This position works under the general guidance of the IT Network Manager.

+ Functions as administrator according to established IT policies and procedures.

+ Meets with end users to gather requirements of business systems and determine hardware specifications.

+ Applies systems analysis techniques and procedures to determine hardware system functional specifications.

+ Works with IT organization on activities appropriate to their discipline under general supervision.

The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:

+ Familiar in the planning, forecasting, implementation, and identification of resource requirements for copper and fiber network systems (including wireless) of moderate complexity.

+ Familiar at managing and configuring startup and running configs for network switch equipment.

+ Must have knowledge and experience with network configurations from DMARC to workstations; fiber distribution, routers, switches, DHCP, and the necessary topology needed to achieve a high QoS.

+ Knowledgeable at monitoring protocol compatibility, performs system tuning and makes recommendations for improvement.

+ Skilled at monitoring, troubleshooting and maintaining network (LAN, WAN and wireless) multiplexers, hubs and routers, and uses remote monitoring tools.

+ Must have the ability to perform capacity and resource planning, assessing network risks and contingency planning.

+ Must know the OSI model and how it pertains to the flow of data throughout the environment.

+ Ability to communicate information to Information Security Team on particular firewall rules needed to support team projects and new equipment/applications.

+ Must have the ability to maintain and utilize network management applications to identify network faults, to ensure the provision of data or other telecommunications access to customers, and the movement of information from one location to the other.

+ Should have completed pertinent IT training related to use and management of Cisco Catalyst and Cisco Nexus switches.

+ Responsible for the maintenance of day-to-day network management tasks, such as VLAN changes, jack connections, and monitoring of potential network failures and outages.

+ Assists with switch configuration, maintenance, monitoring and other various network security measures, as directed by the Infrastructure Solutions Manager or Network Administrator.

+ Reviews requests for Network and Server technology resources. Advises customers of solutions, changes, and implements necessary controls to ensure the compliance with the acquisition process for information technology and other IT procedures.

+ As directed develops a technology assessment that includes the identification of systems, network, operational, work load and resource priorities. Confers with, defines and assists office supervisors in the implementation of established plan to ensure timely processing and completion of responsibilities.

+ Assists and works closely with the Network Administrator on the coordination of Information Technology activities, projects and initiatives. As directed, ensures team participation on task assignments, provides input and represents district interest and concerns. Interprets policies, procedures and rules as needed, providing comments and/or communicating changes to district managers and users.

+ As selected, serve as a member of the Department's Technical Advisory Team attending mandated meetings and teleconferences. Such participation and duties includes but is not limited to technology research, evaluation, deployment and development of industry products.

+ Assists in the development and implementation of security policies, procedures and measures in a networking environment.

+ Analyze the business requirements for the system architecture.


+ Associate's Degree and 1+ years of experience or High School Diploma or GED and 3+ years of experience

+ Must pass a State and Federal criminal history/security background check; many projects clients are security sensitive.

+ Must pass pre-employment drug screen.


+ Ability to lift up to 25 pounds

+ Must be a team player

+ Typically has 1 to 3 years of IT work experience in infrastructure/network environments. CCNA highly desired. Experience interfacing networking with virtual environments desired, as well.Additional Information: Sponsorship for US Employment Authorization is not available for this position.Relocation assistance is not available for this position.


+ Sponsorship for US Employment Authorization is not available for this position.

+ Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

With infrastructure investment accelerating worldwide, our services are in great demand, and there’s never been a better time to be at AECOM! We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

Join us and let’s get started.

Title: Systems Solutions Engineer Lead
Job_Description:
What you'll be doing:
1. Support, maintain and manage a diverse set of networks focused on Multicast deployments and dynamic routing network configurations
2. Develop network automation and day-2 operation practices for enterprise-wide network
3. Provide technical leadership for a team of engineers tasked with daily WAN / LAN operations
4. Administer station Internet/MPLS/ADVPN connections & diverse data centers using BGP with multiple peers and diverse routing paths
5. Work with Security team to manage firewall rules, NAT, and site-to-site VPN connections using OSPF routing, and 3rd party connections developing sustainable and automated procedures
6. Work with Systems Administrators to determine network infrastructure requirements, including iSCSI storage networking, broadcast operation software requirements, and other critical business needs
7. Work with Aruba WIFI, Airwave, and ClearPass, Cisco, Arista, Fortinet, Palo Alto and other networking/security technologies
8. Leverage Nagios for management and monitoring of network devices and services along with other opensource tools for enterprise management
9. Leverage Scrutinizer to analyze NetFlow & SFlow data along with cloud-based SDN packet analysis tools to profile application traffic to identify and correct ongoing problems
10. Provide tier 3 support to Network Team and Stakeholders as required on an on-call basis as part of a larger rotation
11. Develop policies and practices for the network team to elevate the levels of service that the team provides for a diverse set of stakeholders throughout the company
12. Embrace DevOps practices bringing them to the Network Operation team to accelerate deployments, standards, monitoring, fault analysis, and tracking of changes throughout our enterprise

What we're looking for:
1. Deep Knowledge of CCNP level networking required
2. Deep understanding of LAN and WAN Mutilcast deployments
3. Expert knowledge in Network Troubleshooting with a focus on the OSI model
4. 10+ years' experience with large WAN environments
5. 10+ years' experience with complex LAN and Datacenter environments
6. Experience managing large Wi-Fi deployments including Fortinet and Aruba is required
7. Must have knowledge of Python and Ansible for network automation
8. Experience in cloud networking (Azure Express Route and AWS connections) is required
9. Knowledge of Software Defined Networking and Virtual Network Functions (VNF) required
10. Must be able to work independently and as part of an operations team to provide quality customer service
11. Must be able to establish personal relationships with stakeholders understanding their needs and how best to accomplish their goals in a diverse non-standard environment

12. The ability to work in a fast-paced environment where 24x7 communications are required for critical applications
Ability to coach and lead the existing technical team in modern operations and DevOps practices to bring higher levels of automation, documenting, and service to our internal customers

Title: Systems Solutions Engineer Lead
Job_Description:
What You'll Do
As a team member of Cisco's Advanced Security Initiatives Group (ASIG), you will evaluate our global products and services to identify security vulnerabilities, weaknesses, and improvements. You will learn to adopt an attacker mentality using tools, techniques, and processes that emulate real-world adversaries. You will work with amazingly creative, innovative, and collaborative security researchers to develop evolving ethical hacking skills and networking product knowledge. You will partner with Cisco's industry-leading engineering teams to assess the latest system and application architectures, contribute to creative security solutions, and gain unparalleled access to and experience with the latest technologies. You will also have opportunities to research security topics independently or collaboratively to explore and develop tools and ideas as part of our "Free Friday" innovation and incubation process.

Who You'll Work With
Our security team is dynamic, hardworking, fun, and high-energy, but the work is done in a very casual environment that strongly encourages a work/life balance. Not only will you work alongside a team of skilled security researchers with a diverse spectrum of talents and experience levels, but you will also be interacting with a variety of engineering teams across Cisco. Cisco ASIG cultivates an environment where every individual's input and experience is valued. We prioritize training sessions and a mentor program surrounding you with the resources you will need to succeed.

Title: Security Systems Engineer 3 - Boulder, CO
Job_Description:
Job Title: Network Engineer - Voice & Data
Department: I S Data Center Operations
Shift: 1st
Specialty: Networking Technologies
Job Number: 2022-1546
Date Posted: 11/11/2022
Position Type: Information Services

Job Qualifications:

Network Engineer

Rush University Medical Center is one of the country's leading medical centers pushing the boundaries of healthcare services with innovative, compassionate, and accountable team members. Are you ready to challenge and grow your skills, contribute to providing top quality patient care, and enhance your career? Rush is a diverse and inclusive culture, and offers a competitive salary, and a valuable compensation package including health, dental and vision benefits, retirement, health savings accounts, and tuition assistance to invest in your future.
As a Network Engineer for Rush University Medical Center, you will act as an escalation for all Network technologies, while supporting the administration and configuration of a variety of networking hardware and applications. This role will allow you to demonstrate your expertise in the troubleshooting, assessment, management, and implementation of network infrastructure including but not limited to LAN, WAN, DMZ and the Datacenter. You will lead initiatives in managing and enhancing the overall health of the network infrastructure to ensure business continuity and maximum up time. You will work with various teams to drive projects that align with business needs and objectives on both campus and remote sites. You will have a good understanding of routing and switching technologies. You will communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical audiences while managing and further enhancing the delivery of network connectivity offered to the organization across multiple platforms.

The Network Engineer exemplifies the Rush mission, vision and values and acts in accordance with Rush policies and procedures.
Position Responsibilities:
Plan, design, deploy, maintain, and support the hospitals local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), datacenters, including routers, firewalls, switches, VPN appliances, wiring and other hardware as assigned.
Monitor the network to ensure security of data and access privileges.
Analyze and resolve network hardware and software problems in a timely and accurate fashion and provide end-user assistance and training where required.
Conduct research on network products, services, protocols, and standards in support of network procurement and development efforts.
Plan and implement network hardware upgrades, maintenance fixes, and vendor-supplied patches.
Define metrics, monitor, and test and troubleshoot network performance and provide network performance statistics and reports.
Recommend, schedule, and perform network improvements, upgrades, and repairs.
Collaborate with IT management and staff, departments, and other agencies in the development, deployment, and support of new network-based programs and applications.
Provide guidance and technical support to peers and serve as an escalation point for help desk related issues.
Develop, maintain, and ensure the accuracy and completeness of network related technical documentation as needed. Help drive a consistent set of standards for equipment, configuration, and operational procedures.
Coordinate with other team members, court departments and agencies to deliver solutions and configuration items without impacting hospital operations and or patient safety.
Communicate service disruptions.
Position Requirements:
A Valid CCNA.
Subject matter expert for Cisco routers and switches platforms supporting LAN, WAN, Datacenter
5 years of relevant experience in Networking.
5+ years of operational systems and support experience in a large networked WAN environment.
5+ years of data center design.
Excellent working knowledge of network protocols and concepts such as Spanning tree, EIGRP, BGP, HSRP, VOIP, QOS, TCP/IP, 802.1q, 802.1x, MPLS, DNS, Syslog, TACACS, SD-WAN, OSPF.
Ability to work with network security devices such as Cisco IDS/IPS devices, F5, Firepower, Juniper, Palo Alto, ASA, and ACS with an understanding of how to baseline and set alerting features of IDS signatures and work with security policies.
Demonstrated ability on WAN infrastructure consisting of a mixture of MPLS, Point-to-Point, Internet and DMVPN technologies utilizing SD-WAN appliances.
Experience with network access control technologies such as 802.1x.
Working knowledge of remote access VPNs (IPSEC, global protect, DMVPN).
Proficient with monitoring and logging tools for access management and troubleshooting using tools such as Syslog, ACS, Netflow (Plixer scrutinizer) Solarwinds and protocol analyzers.
Prior experience using industry established project management techniques in accomplishing strategic objectives.
Experienced with ITSM functionalities such as change control, CMDB, ticket system.
In depth understanding of disaster recovery, design, implementation, and testing.
Strong working knowledge routing and switching technologies.
Strong working knowledge of IP Addressing and Subnetting, including design and implementation.
Strong working knowledge of DNS and DHCP, including design and implementation.
Strong working knowledge of VLANs and networking to support servers and storage.
Experience supporting large wireless networks environment with Cisco and Meraki.
Experience with Quality of Service, for Voice and Video.
Ability and availability to work occasional nights/weekends assignments as necessary.
Demonstrated ability to work independently and within a team environment to ensure performance, reliability, and security in a dynamic 24-7-365 production network environment.
Some travel may be required.
Customer focused attitude.
Excellent communications skills both written and verbal.
Preferred Job Qualifications:
A Valid CCNP Enterprise.
Experienced with VoIP technologies.
Cloud experience.
Experience with Cisco DNA, ACI, and Meraki SDN.
Company Highlights:
Rush is an academic health system comprising Rush University Medical Center, Rush Copley Medical Center and Rush Oak Park Hospital.
For demonstrating leadership in the use of information technology, Rush University Medical Center and Rush Oak Park Hospital have been listed among the most wired hospitals in the nation by Hospitals & Health Networks magazine.
Ranked among the top academic medical centers in the country, Rush University Medical Center is an outstanding place to enhance your career. Everything we do centers on one goal: improving patient care.
Rush offers a competitive salary, and valuable healthy living benefits including: health, dental and vision to help you maintain and improve your health. Rush also offers several ways to invest in your future.

Rush is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.
